entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 31 at 5:22PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...POTENTIAL FOR FREEZING RAIN WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY... Below-freezing overnight temperatures in combination with warm air moving in overhead may lead to light, intermittent freezing rain through the Kuskokwim Delta beginning Wednesday night. Temperatures warm during the day on Thursday, leading to a pause in the threat of freezing rain. Low temperatures are likely to be
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kuskokwim Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 31 at 2:05PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and Blowing Snow Through Thursday... Periods of snow continue across the North Slope Wednesday into Thursday. A total of 2 to 4 inches is expected with some higher amounts possible. Snow combined with strong wind along the Arctic coast may lead to areas of blowing snow with reduced visibility.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northern Arctic Coast; Northwest Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 31 at 2:03PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Freezing Rain This Evening... Scattered showers are expected this evening and overnight. Some areas that remain near freezing could see brief periods of freezing rain. A light glaze of ice is possible on exposed surfaces.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Noatak Valley; South Slopes of the Western Brooks Range
